content.description: TBD To Be Developed Top-out potentially not recommended.
content.protection: slanted away grass/dirt below. Pad recommended. Climbing/approach shoes recommended. Location on building is not unique.
content.location: On the northeast concave corner of Tom Barnes Education Center.

content.description: Chimney to ledge holds and top-out. Street shoes would work.
content.location: Chimney between small brick walls, several places around the exterior of either "The Crimson White/WVUA FM University Student Radio" building.

content.description: Pattern of white bricks with a myriad of good feet and blocky ledge holds. Just go up, man. Start on the side facing the building for a more interesting top-out. Street shoes work.
content.protection: dirt and a concrete garden barrier below
content.location: South-west facing portion of either "Crimson White/WVUA FM University Student Radio" building. Where the two identical buildings face each other.

content.description: Start low on door hinges. Top out directly above or monkey around on the doorway shelter. Climbing/approach shoes may help with hinges but aren't necessary.
content.location: North facing door on either "The Crimson White/WVUA FM University Student Radio" building.

content.description: Suggested sit start with side pulls on brick. Fun and short little dyno backwards to roof and mantle. Alternatively find more static beta with feet. More fun when you don't take a no-hands rest. Street shoes would work.
content.protection: dirt below. Watch out for drains/pipes in the ground at some locations.
content.location: Northeast and adjacent to Peter Bryce Boulevard. On Northeast Medical Center building.

content.description: Pick somewhere and go up a brick ladder if you want to climb something. Street shoes would work.
content.location: South of and next to Northeast Medical Center building.

content.description: Low face traverse right to left on crimps on square patterned cement material. Top out left for a finish. Don't break anything. Not not chossy. Watch for cars on the road. tight climbing shoes necessary
content.location: North end of Tom Barnes Education Center.

content.description: Climbs on short old buildings with top-outs. Less populated area but watch out for cars on the roads.
